name: TMP
description: The **TMP** environment variable is used to specify the location in which programs can store temporary files. The temporary files are usually deleted after the program exits.

name: PATH
description: The **PATH** environment variable is used to specify a set of directories where executable programs are located. The PATH variable is used by the command processor to find the programs.

name: Conda
description: Anaconda is a free and open-source distribution of the Python and R programming languages for scientific computing, that aims to simplify package management and deployment.

name: miniforge
description: Miniforge is a minimal distribution of Anaconda. It is optimized for speed. Because MiniForge is written in C++, it is faster than the official Conda's Python implementation.

subMatches.name: condabin
subMatches.description: the **condabin** directory in Miniforge contains all the executables.
